alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:40PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Minor Coastal Flooding during Peak High Tide Tuesday to Thursday... Higher than normal high tides, also known as king tides are expected from August 29 to August 31 for the full moon on August 30. These tides can cause scattered coastal flooding, especially in vulnerable low-lying coastal roadways, docks, boat ramps, marina and other coastal infrastructure for the American Samoa Islands. In addition to these king tides, strong winds may also produce higher water levels. Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and be aware of over wash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Please submit any coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org OR call the Weather Service Office at 699-9130. High Tides at Pago Pago Harbor TUESDAY 522 AM TUESDAY 603 PM WEDNESDAY 624 AM WEDNESDAY 655 PM THURSDAY 716 AM THURSDAY 746 PM High Tides at Manu`a Harbor TUESDAY 507 AM TUESDAY 538 PM WEDNESDAY 559 AM WEDNESDAY 630 PM THURSDAY 651 AM THURSDAY 721 PM
